bow: as mom need to know not an anomaly feel like ca have normal conversation anymore like everyone has an opinion and an experience that they must relay to someone else as being the worst possible scenario ll set the scene my 6yo son is with his montessori group at the local pool get voicemail that says my son pushed another child head underwater and is no longer allowed to swim for the remainder of the day the child that had his head pushed underwater is now very afraid to go back into the water obviously go to the pool to pick him up and he is sitting on his towel amongst all of the other children and am met by young girl one of his normal counselors and the owner know looked disappointed because was his counselor asked me if got her voicemail said did the owner then walked up and asked if her counselor had explained to me what happened said she had then began asking specifics about what happened starting with if my son dunked the little boy head or if my son held his head underwater the owner then gave me pretty decent brow beating and began to recount the time she had her head held underwater and how that still terrifies her and began to explain how she told the little boy that story she explained to the little boy how that had happened to her and she scarred for life because of it in my head was thinking do care you had your head held underwater when you were little do care truly do could not care less she had answered my question so instead of repeating myself which can come off rude attempt to rephrase my question so asked do we know if they were fighting or arguing was my son mad or had they been playing my intentions were to understand the situation understand where my son may have been coming from it was to shift blame or to minimize what had happened the owner start stammering and stuttering could tell she was shocked had asked that she said it didnt matter he could have seriously hurt him she then proceeded to walk away then repeat what had asked her to another counselor and shake her head like was complete idiot this was done about ten feet away my son and left and asked him what happened he said he had dunked his friend underwater and his friend said nothing when they got out for break his friend tattled on him then his counselor came over and told him to sit next to the owner he added he and his friend and the counselor were walking to the restroom at break and his friend told the counselor it was an accident and my son corrected him and said it was on purpose after he told me this took him to get an ice cream cone when we are in our pool we dunk each other told him this was an important lesson about keeping your hands to yourself dont think he meant any malice or intended any harm but also know what he did was wrong ll tell you why annoyed annoyed that the owner had to recount her horrific childhood incident to everyone making the incident about her therefore intensifying her feelings of irritation towards my son annoyed that no one could answer any of my questions about what happened because none of them saw it also annoyed that felt judged by merely asking for details and clarification to me that what should be doing asking questions finding out what happened understanding where everyone is coming from the owner added she did think the parents of the little boy my son dunked were going to be very happy if could have texted her my thoughts it would have read does anyone see where coming from this really sounds unprofessional when you re at work like manager that is who you are personal stuff needs left at the door imo if that your son first offense then he should have been corrected maybe separated from the other boy for the rest of the lesson and you notified completely banning him from the pool you re telling me he the first person to dunk someone head underwater anyways you are right to be annoyed that lady was totally making it all about her and trying to string you along for the ride so you fit into her narrative not to mention telling that story to the boys is so wrong and manipulative she just completely changed how those kids see the incident because she had to share her trauma sorry you had to deal with that and that your questions very reasonable went unanswered she was projecting onto that kid no excuses for that it was highly unlikely your child was trying to do something mean to the other child they were probably just playing if that the kind of nonsense you re having to deal with whereby you can even have normal conversation with the professional in charge is start looking for new group you re not an anomaly owner is projecting tit and needs to get over herself and her dunked head kudos to your son for keeping his cool when subjected to idiocy that goddamn life skill if they would answer your questions definitely would find somewhere else kids do crap like that all the time and if your son has done anything like that before think they definitely went overboard if my child had been dunked not forced under for more than seconds or more let it go the fact the kid did freak out and tattle immediately means it was that big of deal think it overreacting on their part but then again no telling how the other kids parents reaction would be so can see both sides all just my opinion though removed wish we unfortunately have limited options in smaller city but do think have thought about it feel like this would be the perfect pep talk for him ✊🏻 yeah ca say how would have reacted my child being the dunkee but have feeling the theatrics when the owner recounts the story will be oscar worthy it is so reasonable that you wanted to have the context that what guides how you coach your kid and help then to understand why dunking at home is ok and dunking that kid was less than great the staff person is very reflective and probably communicates with kids in black and white manner about which behaviours are on the naughty list sounds like you wanted to have much more important and productive conversation about perspective taking and intention keep it up mom the world is crazy place and you re doing good job it their responsibility to keep all students safe whether or not your son was playing or fighting doesn matter if that other child had drowned if the kid was traumatized he would have been distraught and told on your son right away or would have been visibly distressed the fact that they were so hard on your son about what seemed like an incident that was that serious and they did even see is little ridiculous if one of my students came up to me and tattled on another student long after the incident occurred would have lot of questions for both kids to try to sort it out not immediately go to worse case scenario and recount something that may have happened to me your son definitely handled getting sat out very well for year old know lot that would have not done nearly the same the owner had an opportunity to turn this incident into teachable moment for everyone in the group and instead decided drag all parties into an emotional journey from childhood label one child victim and the other an aggressor and send everyone on their way she handled it really badly applaud you for trying to get to the bottom of it often times as parents we can get steamrolled in the moment an later think should have said xyz you did things right and she was 100 wrong for projecting onto your son especially since you learned the reality of what happened the most frustrating part to me is that you were getting harassed for something your son did like he is somehow your avatar or proxy know people judge parents for their kids behavior but six year olds are autonomous boundary pushers isn rough housing par for the course for them what did she hope to accomplish by yelling at you yeah absolutely feel the way you do about all this look grew up with an in ground pool as kid me and my sisters were charged with keeping it clean and making sure to put the cover on when we were using it so it would stay clean from debris we had fence around it with lock parents were responsible and taught us to be responsible got dunked bunch of times in that lol and you know what did yelled stop it or pinched my sister or whoever was doing it and they stopped then the aggressor would get time out if they were being malicious about it or we kept playing if it was accidental know my story has no effect on the counselors experience and that exactly true for her story with regards to your son situation it understandable that she would be more sensitive to this type of situation when she has lasting memory of similar situation it understandable that she feels strongly about pool safety however she is not teaching anyone anything by banning the kid from the pool and think the only case where that would be appropriate is if child has been observed doing this behavior with an obvious mal intent three times three strikes rule would be understandable but your son and the other kid both were playing it sounds like and just got carried away it happens it also sounds like both boys communicated with each other about it and resolved it which is more than the counselor and owner did all they taught the boys was that their feelings accounts of the truth were unimportant and do matter to these adults that problem because in the future if an event occurs that does require adult mediation these kids may not go to an adult because they feel it wo matter because those adults do care to listen to them also sorry but person who has traumatic relationship with water and said she is still afraid of water to this day why is that person chaperone for the pool if it were an actual montessort environment would expect them to actually follow the child and listen to both kids side of the story and not use shaming tactics to make the point that the lo did not make safe choices both kids needed support in that space and the adults made it about them bring it up to the director good thing your lo has you as an advocate feel like that kid would have been fine except for her worst case scenario projecting
